content:
• Friday, November 23, 2018
  • BRS

    After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: BRS +6.56%. MIE +3.74%. NVTA +3.14%. ADT +2.87%. CX +2.74%.
    • Losers: ACIU -4.29%. GLNG -2.44%. CFG -1.73%. TSN -1.49%. FCB -1.47%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • LBTYA

    Belgium to review Telenet deal for De Vijver

    • Belgium's competition regulator will take a look at Liberty Global's (LBTYA +2.8%) plan to take control of De Vijver Media, the European Commission says.
    • The EC referred the deal to the Belgian Competition Authority because of potential impact on the local market.
    • Liberty Global's Telenet planed to operate an advertising joint venture with Corelio's Mediahuis by buying shares it doesn't own in De Vivjer. It got clearance to take a 50% stake in De Vivjer in 2015.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • ANY

    Technology movers and shakers

    • Gainers: Sphere 3D (NASDAQ:ANY) +52%. TSR (NASDAQ:TSRI) +14%. Alpha and Omega Semiconductor (NASDAQ:AOSL) +9%. Castlight Health (NYSE:CSLT) +9%. FTE Networks, Inc. (NYSEMKT:FTNW) +8%.
    • Losers: Ability (NASDAQ:ABIL) -46%. Qudian (NYSE:QD) -15%.Oi S.A. (NYSE:OIBR.C) -8%. Gridsum Holding (NASDAQ:GSUM) -7%. Autohome (NYSE:ATHM) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • SES

    Bristow Group and SilverCrest Metals among Energy/Material losers; Synthesis Energy Systems and Tantech among gainers

    • Gainers: Synthesis Energy Systems (NASDAQ:SES) +9%. Tantech (NASDAQ:TANH) +6%. Sanchez Midstream Partners (NYSEMKT:SNMP) +7%.
    • Losers: Bristow Group (NYSE:BRS) -26%. SilverCrest Metals (NYSEMKT:SILV) -16%. GeoPark (NYSE:GPRK) -14%. Southern Copper (NYSE:SCCO) -12%. First Majestic Silver (NYSE:AG) -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM | 5 Comments
  • EVER

    EverQuote the only financial gainer and Warrior Met Coal the only loser

    • Gainers: EverQuote (NASDAQ:EVER) +9%.
    • Losers: Warrior Met Coal (NYSE:HCC) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM | 2 Comments
  • ANY

    Microcaps dominate midday movers

    • Gainers: Sphere 3D (NASDAQ:ANY) +30%. Overstock.com (NASDAQ:OSTK) +22%. CorMedix (NYSEMKT:CRMD) +18%. TSR (NASDAQ:TSRI) +14%. Tenax Therapeutics (NASDAQ:TENX) +12%. Navios Maritime Acquisition (NYSE:NNA) +12%. Energy Focus (NASDAQ:EFOI) +12%. Navios Maritime Partners (NYSE:NMM) +12%. Kiniksa Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:KNSA) +10%. ZIOPHARM Oncology (NASDAQ:ZIOP) +10%.
    • Losers: Ability (NASDAQ:ABIL) -45%. Bristow Group (NYSE:BRS) -25%. SilverCrest Metals (NYSEMKT:SILV) -15%. Diana Containerships (NASDAQ:DCIX) -14%. GeoPark (NYSE:GPRK) -13%. Southern Copper (NYSE:SCCO) -13%. Qudian (NYSE:QD) -12%. Can-Fite BioPharma (NYSEMKT:CANF) -10%. Legacy Reserves (NASDAQ:LGCY) -9%. MAG Silver (NYSEMKT:MAG) -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • AAL

    U.S. airline stocks rally after another drop in oil prices

    • American Airlines Group (AAL +3.7%), JetBlue (JBLU +1.8%), SkyWest (SKYW +2.8%) and Delta Air Lines (DAL +2.8%) are notably higher after Brent crude oil prices slid to below $60 earlier today.
    • In the oil patch, traders are showing growing apprehension that supply cuts from Saudi Arabia will actually happen and have reeled in global growth expectations for 2019.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM | 4 Comments
  • EFOI

    Energy Focus and New Age Beverages among consumer gainers; Fox Factory Holding the only loser

    • Gainers: Energy Focus (NASDAQ:EFOI) +9%. New Age Beverages (NASDAQ:NBEV) +7%.
    • Losers: Fox Factory Holding (NASDAQ:FOXF) -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • INVVY

    Indivior +4.2% after Canada approves Sublocade for opioid use disorder

    • Indivior (OTCPK:INVVY) rises 4.2% after Health Canada approves Sublocade buprenorphine extended-release injection for the managing moderate to severe opioid use disorder.
    • Sublocade will be available in Canada in H2 2019.
    • The product should be used as part of a treatment plan that includes counseling and psychosocial support, and must only be administered once a month, subcutaneously in the abdominal region by a healthcare provider, Indivior says.
    • Previously: Indivior -12% after court lifts injunction against Suboxone generic (Nov. 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • DCIX

    Diana Containerships slumps 14% as Q3 loss widens

    • Diana Containerships (NASDAQ:DCIX) heads down 14% after reporting Q3 net loss of $6.3M,or 61 cents per share, vs. an $8.7M loss, or $128.67 per share, in the year-ago period.
    • Q3 2018's loss includes a $4.8M impairment charge for one vessel.
    • Q3 time charter revenue of $5.2M fell from $6.7M a year ago due to the company's smaller fleet, partly offset by higher time charter rates.
    • Average number of vessels in Q3 was 4.2 with fleet utilization of 96.8% vs. 11.0 with utilization rate of 81.0% in Q3 2017.
    • Time charter equivalent rate was $12,785 vs. $6,302 Y/Y, while daily vessel operating expenses increased to $7,501 from $6,012.
    • Previously: Diana Containerships reports Q3 results (Nov. 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM | 1 Comment
  • ZIOP

    ZIOPHARM Oncology and AAC Holdings among Healthcare gainers; Soleno Therapeutics and Can-Fite BioPharma among losers

    • Gainers: ZIOPHARM Oncology (NASDAQ:ZIOP) +14%. AAC Holdings (NASDAQ:AAC) +9%. Forty Seven, Inc. (NASDAQ:FTSV) +8%. BeiGene (NASDAQ:BGNE) +8%. CymaBay Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CBAY) +8%.
    • Losers: Soleno Therapeutics (NASDAQ:SLNO) -7%. Can-Fite BioPharma (NYSEMKT:CANF) -6%. Bioblast Pharma (NASDAQ:ORPN) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • ATEN

    A10 +4.6% on sale exploration report

    • A10 Networks (NYSE:ATEN) is exploring strategic options including a potential sale, according to Reuters sources.
    • The deliberations are still in the early stage and details could change.
    • A10's shares have dropped over 60% since the company went public four years ago.
    • Competitors: (FFIV +0.5%), (CTXS -0.3%), (RDWR +1.1%).
    • ATEN is up 4.6% to $6.10.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • STG

    Sunlands Online Education -5.2% post Q3 results

    • Sunlands Online Education (STG -5.2%) reports Q3 revenue growth of 95.8% Y/Y to RMB517M, the increase was mainly driven by the growth in new student enrollments.
    • Adj. gross billings were RMB755.8M (+14% Y/Y) & New student enrollments were 120,241 (+14.5% Y/Y).
    • Gross profit increased by 93.5% Y/Y to RMB424.4M, but margin declined by 94 bps to 82%.
    • Adj. EBIDTA was –RMB243.4M from –RMB259.7M Y/Y & Deferred revenue was RMB3,116.2M.
    • Cash & equivalents of RMB1,278.7M & Short-term investments of RMB1,088.2M.
    • Capex was RMB10.3M from RMB86.7M Y/Y
    • Q4 Outlook: Net revenues of RMB540-560M, which would represent an increase of 56.7%-62.5% Y/Y.
    • Previously: Sunlands Online Education reports Q3 results (Nov. 23 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • WHR

    IBM forecasts 4.8% growth for retail holiday sales

    • IBM forecasts the retail sector will see 4.83% growth this holiday season.
    • The pace is higher than last year's holiday sales mark of 4.2%.
    • IBM projects that consumer appliances will lead all product categories with 15.2% projected growth, while jewelry (+5.2%) and apparel (+12.7% men's clothing, 4.3% women's clothing, +14.2% other apparel) are also seen coming in strong.
    • Some companies that could benefit if those marks are accurate are Whirlpool (WHR +0.2%), Best Buy (BBY +0.1%), Signet (SIG -1.8%), Tailored Brands (TLRD -1.3%) and Nordstrom (JWN -0.6%).
    • "The retail industry is extremely dynamic and a host of powerful factors such as the economy, fast-moving market trends and consumer confidence all come into play," says IBM exec Michael Haydock.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM | 9 Comments
  • CPA

    Latin American airline stocks show gains

    • Latin American airline stocks are higher despite the broad market decline and concerns on global growth.
    • Naturally, the sharp decline of crude oil prices is a positive for the sector as long as it doesn't foreshadow a drop in global demand for airline tickets.
    • Copa Holdings (CPA +4.9%), Gol Linhas (GOL +2.7%), Azul (AZUL +1.1%) and LATAM Airline (LTM +0.9%) are all making gains.
    • Earlier today, Copa was named the favorite Latin American airline stock by JPMorgan.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM | 4 Comments
  • FCEL

    FuelCell -2.8% as Roth goes Neutral

    • Roth Capital downgrades FuelCell Energy (NASDAQ:FCEL) from Buy to Neutral and drops the target from $2.10 to $0.80.
    • Analyst Craig Irwin cites weak new project booking momentum after the early 2018 ITC renewal. Without evidence of third parties financially participating in FCE's plants, Irwin expects the generation portfolio buildout to become materially more challenging.
    • FCEL shares are down 2.8% premarket to $0.75
     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM | 13 Comments
  • GASS

    StealthGas EPS in-line, beats on revenue

    • StealthGas (NASDAQ:GASS): Q3 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.01 in-line; GAAP EPS of -$0.02 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $42.72M (+10.8% Y/Y) beats by $4.66M.
    • Shares +1.82% PM.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM

  • DCIX

    Thin ranks in premarket gainers

    • Diana Containerships (NASDAQ:DCIX) +17% on Q3 result.
    • Rockwell Collins (NYSE:COL) +8% on receiving final regulatory approval.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • DCIX

    Diana Containerships reports Q3 results

    • Diana Containerships (NASDAQ:DCIX): Q3 GAAP EPS of -$0.61.
    • Revenue of $5.23M (-22.3% Y/Y)
    • Shares +15.78% PM.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM | 21 Comments

  • Futures turn lower - Nasdaq down 1%

    • Down only modestly for most of the morning, U.S. stock index futures have turned decidedly lower, led by the Nasdaq's 1% decline. S&P 500 futures are off 0.8%.
    • Crude is adding to big declines, now down 7% to $50.85 per barrel.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • ABIL

    Ability -38% on registered offering pricing

    • Ability (NASDAQ:ABIL) prices a registered offering of 3,076,923 units at $3.25 per unit to a single institutional purchaser.
    • Each unit consists of one ordinary share (or equivalent) and a warrant to purchase one ordinary share.
    • Ability expects aggregate gross proceeds of approximately $10 million from the offering.
    • Ability shares are down 38.6% premarket to $3.41.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM | 3 Comments
  • C

    Deutsche Bank, Citi slip after Citi CEO squelches tie-up speculation

    • Deutsche Bank slides 1.2% and Citigroup (NYSE:C) slips 0.4% in premarket trading after Citi CEO Michael Corbat dismisses a potential tie-up between the two international mega-banks, saying there's "too much overlap" between the businesses, according to a report in Manager Magazin, a German business publication.
    • Corbat further explained that a merger based solely on cost savings would be a good idea.
    • Previously: Deutsche Bank's move to reduce risk backfires (Nov. 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:22 AM | 3 Comments
  • FB

    Open Society head wants Facebook oversight

    • Patrick Gaspard, the head of George Soros' philanthropic foundation Open Society, calls for congressional oversight on Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) hiring opposition firm Definers.
    • Gaspard tweets that Definers "was tasked by company leadership to target and smear George Soros because he publicly criticized their out of control business model."
    • Facebook shares are down 0.5% premarket to $134.
    • Previously: Facebook publishes memo where policy chief owns up to PR firm hiring (Nov. 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:19 AM | 52 Comments
  • AAPL

    WSJ: IPhone XR discounts for Japan?

    • Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) will offer subsidies to mobile operators in Japan to allow for iPhone XR discounts due to underwhelming sales.
    • The XR price cuts in the region could happen as early as next week, according to WSJ sources.
    • Earlier this week, the WSJ reported that Apple slowed production on all three iPhone models released this year with the XR suffering the most drastic cuts.
    • Apple shares are down 0.5% premarket to $175.90.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:06 AM | 97 Comments
  • OSTK

    Overstock.com plans to sell retail business

    • Overstock.com (NASDAQ:OSTK) shoots higher in early trading after CEO Patrick Byrne tells The Wall Street Journal that he expects the company to sell its retail business by February.
    • Of course, Byrne is one of the biggest proponents of the potential for the blockchain and Overstock's tZero business in particular.
    • "I don’t care whether tZero is losing $2 million a month," Byrne says. "We think we’ve got cold fusion on the blockchain side," he notes.
    • OSTK +6.01% premarket to $18.00.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:57 AM | 26 Comments

  • Energy sector down 2% as crude plunges

    • Oil's down more than 4% to a new 2018 low of $52 per barrel.
    • That's got the Energy SPDR (NYSEARCA:XLE) down 2% premarket vs. just a 0.2% decline for the S&P 500.
    • ETFs: XLE, VDE, XOP, ERX, OIH, ERY, DIG, BGR, GUSH, FENY, IYE, DUG, DRIP, IEO, FIF, NDP, PXE, RYE, PXJ
    • Previously: Crude hits 2018 lows at $53 per barrel (Nov. 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:53 AM | 39 Comments
  • UTX

    UTX/Rockwell deal wins China approval; COL +9%

    • Bloomberg is reporting the relevant Beijing regulator as posting approval of the deal to its website.
    • UTX +3.7%, COL +9.3%
     
     
     
     
    | 7:35 AM | 12 Comments
  • NVS

    Novartis lands Luxturna approval

    • Novartis (NYSE:NVS) lands approval from the European Union for its Luxturna gene therapy to restore sight to people with a rare retinal disease.
    • Luxturna is described as an one-time treatment for children and adults who have suffered impaired vision from an early age due to mutations in both copies of the RPE65 gene.
    • Source: Reuters Morning Call
    • NVS -1.73% premarket to $87.49.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:33 AM | 4 Comments
  • FOXF

    Fox Factory slips after BAML cut

    • Bank of America Merrill Lynch downgrades Fox Factory Holdings (NASDAQ:FOXF) to a Neutral rating from Buy on the expectation of a slowdown in earnings growth.
    • "We expect EPS growth to moderate in 2019E to the low-double digit range (vs. roughly 25% CAGR from 2014-2018E) as FOXF reinvests some of its improved top-line into capacity expansion," writes the BAML analyst team.
    • The firm assigns a price objective of $70 to Fox Factory.
    • FOXF -2.53% to $65.88.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:29 AM | 1 Comment
